info.title: VTEX Ad Network API
info.description:
VTEX Ad Network connects VTEX stores with brands interested in advertising their products. This connection allows advertisers and publishers to boost their business:

* **Advertisers:** Brands that can create ad campaigns to promote products in VTEX stores offering the same products in their catalogs, thus increasing sales. 

* **Publishers:** Can offer ad space in their stores for advertisers to promote products. In return, these publishers will receive a fee for each click on an ad in their stores.

> Learn more about [VTEX Ad Network](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/vtex-ad-network-beta--2cgqXcBuJmXN2livQvClur).

## Index
### Sponsored products
 `GET` [Get sponsored products for a query](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/vtex-ad-network-api#get-/sponsored_products/-facets-)
### Ad events
 `POST` [Send ad events](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/vtex-ad-network-api#post-/ads)
### Order events
 `POST` [Send order events](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/vtex-ad-network-api#post-/order)
### Banner
 `POST` [Get banner information](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/vtex-ad-network-api#post-/banner/query)
## Common parameters 

| **Parameter name** | **Description**   |
| --------------- | ----------------- | 
| `{{accountName}}` | Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL. |  
| ` {{environment}}` | Environment to use. Used as part of the URL. |

accountName.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

environment.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL.

servers.description: VTEX Ad Network server URL, integrated with Intelligent Search.

accountName.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

environment.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL.

servers.description: VTEX Ad Network Activity Flow server.
VTEX Ad Network server URL, integrated with Intelligent Search.

accountName.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

environment.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL.

get.summary: Get sponsored products for a query
get.description:
Lists sponsored products for a given search query. This endpoint must be used when the merchant uses a third-party search engine.

## Permissions

This endpoint does not require [authentication](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication) or [permissions](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3).

example.description: Introducing our exquisite Top Wood Clock, a timeless blend of elegance and craftsmanship. Crafted from premium-quality wood, this clock seamlessly combines functionality with aesthetic appeal. Its sleek design and rich wood finish make it a sophisticated addition to any space, from classic to contemporary interiors.

Introducing our stunning Metal Clock, a perfect blend of sophistication and durability. Crafted from high-quality metal, this clock seamlessly combines functionality with aesthetic appeal. Its sleek design and polished metal finish make it a stylish addition to any space, from modern to industrial interiors.

post.description:
Sends ad events, including impressions, views, and clicks, according to these rules:

* **Impressions:** Must be sent when the ad is rendered in the interface.

* **Views:** Must be sent when the ad appears more than 50% on the screen for more than 1s.

* **Click:** Must be sent when the ad is clicked.

>⚠️ The `MacId` and the `SessionID` are required and must be handled as described in the table below. They are used as anonymous identifiers to link events with orders. These attributes are the merchant's responsibility, and they must be managed at the device level.

## Permissions

This endpoint does not require [authentication](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication) or [permissions](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3).

accountName.description: Merchant's account name. It should be the same as the account name registered at VTEX.

MacId.description: A long-life identifier stored in the browser cookies or device of each shopper. It is valid for one year and is renewed as new events are sent. It expires if the user clears their cookies or deletes the app. Use UUID Version 4.

Url.description: Current page URL or the current mobile view.

Ref.description: Previous page URL (accessed before the current page URL) or mobile equivalent.

SessionId.description: Session identifier, which expires after 30 minutes. Use UUID Version 4.

placement.description: Refers to where the ad is shown on the site.

position.description: Position of the ads in the list.

adRequestId.description: Identifier of an ad request. This ID should be retrieved through the [ad request](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/vtex-ad-network-api#get-/sponsored_products/-facets-).

adResponseId.description: Identifier of an ad response. This ID should be retrieved through the [ad request](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/vtex-ad-network-api#get-/sponsored_products/-facets-).

actionType.description: Type of action associated with the event.

productId.description: Product ID associated with the ad event.

productName.description: Product name associated with the ad event.

campaignId.description: Campaign ID to which the ad belongs.

adId.description: Ad identifier associated with the ad event. This ID should be retrieved through the [ad request](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/vtex-ad-network-api#get-/sponsored_products/-facets-).

channel.description: Specifies if it is a mobile or web client.

post.description:
Sends order events.

## Permissions

This endpoint does not require [authentication](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication) or [permissions](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3).

accountName.description: Merchant's account name. It should be the same as the account name registered at VTEX.

macId.description: A long-life identifier stored in the browser cookies or device of each shopper. It is valid for one year and is renewed as new events are sent. It expires if the user clears their cookies or deletes the app. Use UUID Version 4.

url.description: Current page URL or the current mobile view.

ref.description: Previous page URL (accessed before the current page URL) or mobile equivalent.

sessionId.description: Session identifier, which expires after 30 minutes. Use UUID Version 4.

orderGroup.description: Order group ID for the created order. The order group ID is a segment of the order ID that groups all orders related to the same purchase. For example, in order ID `v71021570str-02`, the order group ID is `v71021570str`. The `orderGroup` value should be the same as the one created in the OMS to enable the correlation between the order events and the order tables.

channel.description: Specifies if it is a mobile or web client.

post.description:
Retrieves banner information. Applicable to non-VTEX stores integrating with VTEX Ad Network with targeting.

## Permissions

This endpoint does not require [authentication](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication) or [permissions](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3).

accountName.description: Merchant's account name. It should be the same as the account name registered at VTEX.

adUnit.description: Ad unit, which refers to the ad type.

channel.description: Specifies if it is a mobile or web client.

placement.description: Refers to where the ad is shown on the site.

query.name: query
query.description: Search term. It can contain any character.

facetsPath.name: facets
facetsPath.description:
## Format

The `facets` parameter follows the format: `/${facetKey1}/${facetValue1}/${facetKey2}/${facetValue2}/.../${facetKeyN}/${facetValueN}`.

The order in which the terms appear is not relevant to the search.

You can also repeat the same `facetKey` several times for different values. For example: `category-1/shoes/color/blue/color/red/color/yellow`.

## General filters

The `facets` parameter also allows the following general filters:

| `facetKey` | Description | Example |
| - | - | - |
| `price` | Filter the search by a price range, following the format `${minPrice}:${maxPrice}`. | `/color/blue/price/100:500?query=shirt` |
| `category-${n}` | Filter the search by category, where `n` represents the category tree level (1 = department, 2 = category, 3 = subcategory, and so on). | `category-1/clothing/category-2/shirts` |
| `productClusterIds` | Filter the search by collection, following the format `productClusterIds/{collectionId}`. | `productClusterIds/262` |
| `trade-policy` |  Filter the search by trade policy (also known as sales channel), following the format `trade-policy/{tradePolicyId}`. | `trade-policy/2`|

sponsoredCount.name: sponsoredCount
sponsoredCount.description: Amount of sponsored products to be returned in the response.

products.name: products
products.description: Product IDs separated by `;`. Used only by VTEX Ad Network integrations without targeting, to verify if the informed products are sponsored and sort them based on the merchant's criteria.

locale.name: locale
locale.description: Indicates the target language as a BCP 47 language code. The Intelligent Search must have indexed the account in the target language.

simulationBehavior.name: simulationBehavior
simulationBehavior.description:
Defines the simulation behavior.

 * `default` - Calls the simulation for every single seller.
 * `skip` - Never calls the simulation.
 * `only1P` - Only calls the simulation for first party sellers.

hideUnavailableItems.name: hideUnavailableItems
hideUnavailableItems.description: Defines whether the result should hide unavailable items (`true`), or not (`false`).

fuzzy.name: fuzzy
fuzzy.description: Indicates how the search engine will correct misspelled words by using fuzzy logic. It can be a number representing the max number of misspelled letters, or the string `auto` suggesting that the search-engine should set this value by itself.

operator.name: operator
operator.description: Indicates how the search-engine will deal with the fullText if there is more than one word. Set `and` if the returned products must have all the words in its metadata or `or` otherwise.

adId.description: The unique Ad ID for this product.

campaignId.description: The campaign ID associated with this ad.

actionCost.description: The cost charged to the advertiser for the specific action (e.g.: cost per click).

adRequestId.description: ID for the ad request. Unique for each request.

adResponseId.description: ID for the ad response. Unique for each request.

categoriesIds.description: List of category IDs in the corresponding category path.

Price.description: Price of the delivery SLA type in cents.

BuyTogether.description: Array of other items that can be bought together with the item in question.

items.description: Unique identifier of each SKU that can be bought together.

NameComplete.description: Complete name of the product combined with the SKU name.

required.description: Defines whether the attachment is required (`true`) or not (`false`).

RewardValue.description: Credit that the customer receives when finalizing an order that includes the SKU. By filling this field out with `1`, the customer receives credit on the site in the selected currency, e.g. U$ 1.

PriceValidUntil.description: Date until the price is valid, in ISO 8601 format.

CacheVersionUsedToCallCheckout.description: Cache version used to call Checkout.

conditions.description: Conditions for the promotion the be valid.

minimumQuantity.description: Minimum quantity of the item for the promotion to be valid.

imageTag.description: HTML tag for the selected image.

nameComplete.description: Combination of the product name with the SKU name.

measurementUnit.description: Measurement unit. This field should only be used when it is necessary to convert the unit of measure for sale. For example, if a product is sold in boxes, but customers want to buy per square meter (m²). In common cases, use `'un'`.

unitMultiplier.description: Multiple number of SKU. If the multiplier is 5.0000, the product can be added in multiple quantities of 5, 10, 15, 20, onward.

modalType.description: Links an unusual type of SKU that needs special transportation, such as meat, glass, or a mattress, to a carrier specialized in delivering it. This field should be filled in with the name of the modal (e.g. "Chemicals" or "Refrigerated products"). To learn more about this feature, read our articles [How the modal works](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/how-does-the-modal-work--tutorials_125) and [Setting up modal for carriers](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/configure-modal--3jhLqxuPhuiq24UoykCcqy).

attachments.description: Array with information about the attachments that are related to the SKU.

required.description: Defines if the attachment is required (`true`) or not (`false`).

isKit.description: Defines whether the SKU is made up of one or more SKUs (part of a kit) (`true`) or not (`false`). Must be enabled if you are adding a kit. Once activated, this definition cannot be reverted.

origin.description: Origin of products in the trade policy.
